tools.name: api-health
tools.description: Checks the health and availability of Veracode API endpoints

tools.name: dynamic-findings
tools.description:
Get runtime vulnerabilities from DYNAMIC analysis scans.

Returns: Auth/session flaws, authorization bypasses, misconfigurations, CSRF, clickjacking, missing headers
Includes: CWE ID, URL, HTTP details, attack vectors, severity, status
Related: static-findings (source code)

Display as table: | Flaw ID | Severity | CWE | Status | URL | Description |

params.name: application_path
params.description: The absolute path to the application directory or workspace to scan. The path MUST be absolute and have an appropriate path separator. The absolute path can be retrieved by invoking `pwd` on the command line in the working directory. Example: `/a/my-workspace` on linux/macOS or, on Windows `C:\\a\my-workspace`.

params.name: app_profile
params.description: Application Profile name to get findings for. If not provided, will automatically read from .veracode-workspace.json in the application directory.

params.name: severity
params.description: Filter findings with severity equal to the specified value. Severity scale: 0=Informational, 1=Very Low, 2=Low, 3=Medium, 4=High, 5=Very High. Example: 3 returns Medium, High, and Very High findings.

params.name: severity_gte
params.description: Filter findings with severity greater than or equal to the specified value. Severity scale: 0=Informational, 1=Very Low, 2=Low, 3=Medium, 4=High, 5=Very High. Example: 3 returns Medium, High, and Very High findings.

params.name: cwe_ids
params.description: Filter findings by CWE IDs. Provide one or more CWE IDs as numbers without the 'CWE-' prefix. Example: [89, 79] for SQL Injection and XSS. Can be combined with severity filters.

params.name: size
params.description: Number of findings per page (1-500). Default is 50. Use smaller values for faster responses.

params.name: page
params.description: Page number for pagination (0-based). Use for large result sets. Default is 0

params.name: violates_policy
params.description: Filter findings by policy violation status. Set to true to return only findings that violate policy, false for non-violating findings. If omitted, returns all findings regardless of policy status.

params.name: include_mitigations
params.description: Include mitigation/annotation information for findings. Default is false. Set to true to include proposed mitigations, approvals, and other annotation details.

tools.name: static-findings
tools.description:
Get source code vulnerabilities from STATIC analysis scans. Calls Veracode API to retrieve real scan findings. Returns interactive UI with findings.

Returns: XSS, SQL injection, crypto issues, race conditions, buffer overflows, unsafe functions
Includes: CWE ID, file path, line number, severity, status, policy violations
Related: get-dynamic-findings (runtime)

tools.name: get-sca-findings
tools.description:
Get third-party library vulnerabilities from SCA (Software Composition Analysis) scans.

Returns: Vulnerable dependencies, outdated libraries, license issues, known CVEs in open source components
Includes: CWE ID, CVE ID, component name/version, CVSS score, severity, status
Related: get-static-findings (source code), get-dynamic-findings (runtime)

Display as table: | Severity | CWE | CVE | Component | Version | Description |

tools.name: package-workspace
tools.description: Package the current workspace for Veracode security scanning.

params.name: application_path
params.description: The absolute path to the application directory or workspace to scan. The path MUST be absolute and have an appropriate path separator. The absolute path can be retrieved by invoking `pwd` on the command line in the working directory. Example: `/a/my-workspace` on linux/macOS or, on Windows `C:\\a\my-workspace`.

params.name: filename
params.description: Optional output filename for the packaged artifact. If just a filename (no path) is provided, it will be created in the .veracode-packaging directory. If a full path is provided, it will be used as-is.

params.name: verbose
params.description: Enable verbose/debug output from Veracode CLI. Creates a timestamped log file with detailed output.

params.name: logToFile
params.description: Write detailed output to a log file in ./.veracode-packaging

params.name: application_path
params.description: The absolute path to the application directory or workspace to scan. The path MUST be absolute and have an appropriate path separator. The absolute path can be retrieved by invoking `pwd` on the command line in the working directory. Example: `/a/my-workspace` on linux/macOS or, on Windows `C:\\a\my-workspace`.

params.name: filename
params.description: The file upon which to perform a pipeline scan. If just a filename (no path) is provided, it will look in the .veracode_packaging folder. If a full or relative path is provided, it will be used as-is. If not provided, the tool will scan the largest file in the .veracode_packaging folder

When presenting results, create clickable file links for all source files and line numbers mentioned in the data paths using markdown link format: [filename](path#L123) or [path:line](path#L123)
